Expected: Ó should be typed.

data.title: VSCode keep not responding when opening large project/files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 64-bit build 14393

my visual studio code is always not responding or crashes when i opening my project. i use laravel framework, so that mean it contains a lots of files including the files that i created my own.. it always stuck after 5-10 mins after my project is opened.. 

buttons "Keep Waiting" and "Reopen" also doesn't work, i already tried to keep waiting, but it's never responding again. i tried reopen, but it's also not reopening vscode.. 

hope you guys can fix this, because i really love this editor :) 

Right now i use sublime text or atom until vscode is normal again.. 

Additional informations : 
- i have about 20 plugins/extentions installed
- my project size is about 20MB and about 5000+ files
- i also use git (just information)

and i apologize if my english is not very good, but i tried my best.. Thank You guys, keep spirit :)

data.title: Missing command to open errors / warnings window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversary Update

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode
2. Write some code with syntactical errors (eg. NodeJS)
3. Notice that the lower-left corner of VSCode indicates more than 0 errors or warnings
4. If you click the errors/warnings, an Error pane will appear in VSCode
5. Hit `F1` to open the command palette
6. Search for `error`
7. Notice that there is no command in the Command Palette to invoke the errors / warnings window that appears in step 4

Cheers,
**Trevor Sullivan**
Docker Captain
Microsoft MVP: Cloud & Data Center Management
https://trevorsullivan.net
https://twitter.com/pcgeek86

data.title: Add a setting to bypass recycle bin or detect if recycle bin is supported
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select the menu File-OpenFolder, to open a folder on a portable storage device, such as a USB Disk.
2. Remove a file from the opened folder, then it asks whether move the file into recyclebin or not.
3. If you choose "Move it to recyclebin", it will fail, because there is no recyclebin for a USB Disk.

**Suggest:**

Add an option `disableRecycleBin` in file `.vscode/settings.json`, so that we can tell the VSCode not to use recyclebin for a specific project/folder.

data.title: Improve Markdown Syntax Highlighting of Nested Lists
data.body: **Bug** Indented lists in markdown stop highlighting after four indents, even if they are nested. For this markdown: ``` * a * text **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** * code **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** * text **bold** code **bold** ``` The colorization currently is: **Fix** Allow lists to also match the start of the line instead of the anchor point in their while clause. Here's the new colorization: The new colorization is mostly correct, except that we cannot handle single blank lines without any whitespace between list elements. This is shown in the last element of the list not being properly highlighted.

data.title: Extension activation fails as `env` is null when restoring VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Today I noticed language extensions like https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code and https://github.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode failed to activate.

Both fails as `env` is null when being activated. Dart for example:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/19790262/c1ff38e8-9c6b-11e6-8d83-655f1923cb8a.png)

The line in trouble:
(Put a log, will use it soon in gif)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/19790287/fe0acd52-9c6b-11e6-9656-2c3daf1a7725.png)

This is in the beginning of that file:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/19790433/fab2b5c4-9c6c-11e6-8ec6-536b401cb010.png)

Now, if I go to a Dart project and open a dart file, the Dart extension will activate correctly. However, if I leave an open tab, and restart VSCode, so it restores the tab, Dart extension fails to activate, as `env` is null.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/19790420/d067e816-9c6c-11e6-9fbe-102e5a4849ae.gif)

Also happened to @roblourens 

I'll be available tonight. Let me know how can I help if you can't repro.

data.title: Tmux in integrated terminal ignores mouse scroll events/shits itself on selection events
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: osx 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal in vscode
2. `tmux attach`
3. Enable mouse mode in tmux `set -g mouse on`
4. Scroll or select text in terminal window

Maybe not an issue with vscode itself, but thought I might open this here since this is where I'm experiencing this. All mouse activity works pretty perfectly in Terminal.app

data.title: Fix Fenced Code Syntax Highlighting in Markdown Leaking
data.body: ### Bug This builds on #14488 to fix a number of issues where syntax highlighting leaks outside of code blocks in markdown files. A simple repo currently is this markdown: `````` **a** ```js ( ``` **a** `````` Which is incorrectly colored as: ### Fix Leverage the updated while rule logic from #14488 to break out of language syntax highlighting when the end of a code block is detected: Also includes work to fix fenced code blocks where the size of the trailing fence is larger than the size of the starting fence: `````` ```js 1; ````` `````` And cases such as: `````` ```js 1; ````` `````` Possibly fixed issues include #9457, #8903, #8259, #13149, and others This is not something we'd want to take into the current months release. I'd like to get some usage in insiders builds and target next month's release.

Reproducible with Python extension in both Insider and stable.

data.title: Support instances across Win-10 virtual desktops
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode on one virtual desktop.
2. Create a new virtual desktop.
3. Open VSCode.

The result is that windows will take you back the first desktop instead of spawning a new instance on the new desktop.

data.title: Ctrl+Alt+Up Down Arrow flips display upside down.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. press ctrl+alt+down arrow

In your shortcuts on an empty window you say that this will add cursors. Instead it flips the display of everything on the screen upside down. You need to provide a different hotkey sequence for this.

data.title: Extension details view should show Marketplace version of README and CHANGELOG

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.0 insiders

I'm not sure which version of the README and CHANGELOG is displayed in the details view but I think it should be the Marketplace versions.  We show the user what they will get if they install the update. For the changelog, the user should be able to match the changelog entry versions to their installed version which is displayed in the Extension view tile.

The other choice is also valid, show the user what they have installed but I prefer to see the latest version of both the README and CHANGELOG.

data.title: workbench.debug.viewlet.action.reapplyBreakpointsAction does not call setExceptionBreakPointsRequest on the debugger when only exception breakpoints are set.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: OX X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set an exception breakpoint
2.  Call `workbench.debug.viewlet.action.reapplyBreakpointsAction` from extension code.

Expected:
`setExceptionBreakPointsRequest` called on debugger.
Actual:
`setExceptionBreakPointsRequest` is not called.
1. Set a line breakpoint on a source file.
2. Call `workbench.debug.viewlet.action.reapplyBreakpointsAction` from extension code.

`setExceptionBreakPointsRequest` is called as expected (along with `setBreakPointsRequest` for the line breakpoint).

data.title: Allow users to restore files instead of just folders while restarting Code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch VS Code, open several files separately in Code instead of any folder
2. Close VS Code
3. Launch VS Code again, Code opens a blank file instead of previous opened files

Currently folders can be restored while files can not.
